bug.short_desc: [abrt] guake: common.py:53:test_gconf:GError: Configuration server couldn't be contacted: D-BUS error: Did not receive a reply. Possible causes include: the remote application did not send a reply, the message bus security policy blocked the reply, ...
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext: Version-Release number of selected component: guake-0.8.5-1.fc24 Additional info: reporter: libreport-2.7.1 cmdline: python2 -m guake.main -t dso_list: python-libs-2.7.11-6.fc24.x86_64 executable: /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/guake/main.py kernel: 4.6.3-300.fc24.x86_64 pkg_fingerprint: 73BD E983 81B4 6521 pkg_vendor: Fedora Project reproducible: Not sure how to reproduce the problem runlevel: N 5 type: Python uid: 1000 Truncated backtrace: common.py:53:test_gconf:GError: Configuration server couldn't be contacted: D-BUS error: Did not receive a reply. Possible causes include: the remote application did not send a reply, the message bus security policy blocked the reply, the reply timeout expired, or the network connection was broken. Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/runpy.py", line 162, in _run_module_as_main "__main__", fname, loader, pkg_name) File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/runpy.py", line 72, in _run_code exec code in run_globals File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/guake/main.py", line 243, in <module> exec_main() File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/guake/main.py", line 234, in exec_main if not test_gconf(): File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/guake/common.py", line 53, in test_gconf return c.dir_exists('/apps/guake') GError: Configuration server couldn't be contacted: D-BUS error: Did not receive a reply. Possible causes include: the remote application did not send a reply, the message bus security policy blocked the reply, the reply timeout expired, or the network connection was broken. Local variables in innermost frame: c: <gconf.Client object at 0x7f154c4d4d70 (GConfClient at 0x560a212efc00)>
